DataElement.preferredName: Person MGMT Abnormality Verification Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator related to the verification of a MGMT abnormality.  MGMT is an enzyme that transfers methyl groups from O(6) methylguanine and other methylated moities of DNA, to a cysteine residue in itself, thus repairing alkylated DNA in a single step reaction.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person MGMT Abnormality Verification Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the verification of a MGMT abnormality.  MGMT is an enzyme that transfers methyl groups from O(6) methylguanine and other methylated moities of DNA, to a cysteine residue in itself, thus repairing alkylated DNA in a single step reaction.

Property.preferredName: Methylated-DNA--Protein-Cysteine Methyltransferase Abnormality Verification Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: enzyme that transfers methyl groups from O(6) methylguanine and other methylated moities of DNA, to a cysteine residue in itself, thus repairing alkylated DNA in a single step reaction:A condition that differs from the usual physical or mental state.:Support or establish by evidence or proof.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Methylated-DNA-protein-cysteine methyltransferase (207 aa, ~22 kDa) is encoded by the human MGMT gene. This protein is involved in both repair and dealkylation of DNA.
A condition that differs from the usual physical or mental state.
Support or establish by evidence or proof.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
